page.title: 13HALTON SINGERS
page.content: The Halton Singers- formed in 1973- are a group of adults interested in singing madrigals, hymns, carols and folk music. All singing is unaccompanied. They first performed in Saint Andrews Church, Halton Holegate and during the years have performed at many musical concerts at various locations. The Singers- both male and female- practise on average once a week -on a Thursday evening at a member's house in the village. For concerts, the men wear dark suits and sometimes a bow tie; the ladies- long black skirts and white blouses. There are three of the original singers remaining in the group- and numbers have varied from four to nine. The only qualification to join is an adult singing voice.
